channel.title: Increasing the max amount of an item to 9,223,372,036,854,775,807-Long data type
channel.description: Well i was thinking since the max amount of an item is a 32-bit signed two's complement integer(2,147,483,647)..well i was thinking if we used the long data type instead of a int data type could we increase this to a 64-bit signed two's complement integer? witch would increase the max value of memory to 9,223,372,036,854,775,807 so we could increase the max amount of an item..or any other value that uses so much data? but i was wondering if the clients can hold 64-bit memory.

item.title: Increasing the max amount of an item to 9,223,372,036,854,775,807-Long data type
item.dc:creator: @ziplock ziplock
item.description:
@ziplock wrote:

Yea, i was going to attempt this until i ran into the problem of the client handling the 64-bit memory and still being compatible with the cache…

Read full topic
item.source: Increasing the max amount of an item to 9,223,372,036,854,775,807-Long data type

item.title: Increasing the max amount of an item to 9,223,372,036,854,775,807-Long data type
item.dc:creator: @zyle1992 Zymus
item.description:
@zyle1992 wrote:

replace the int to a long, and reconfigure your server to accept long values.

Read full topic
